title: APOE ε4 allele and Alzheimer disease risk
text: The rs429358 variant in the APOE gene is strongly associated with increased Alzheimer disease risk across multiple populations. This variant increases disease risk by approximately 3-fold in heterozygotes and 15-fold in homozygotes.

title: TREM2 variants in neurodegeneration
text: Rare coding variants in TREM2, including rs75932628, significantly affect microglial function and increase risk for late-onset Alzheimer disease. The R47H variant increases AD risk approximately 3-fold.

title: BIN1 locus and tau pathology
text: Common variants near BIN1 at rs744373 are associated with Alzheimer disease risk. BIN1 variants modulate tau pathology and affect endosomal trafficking in neurons.

title: CLU genetic associations in AD
text: The clusterin gene CLU contains several variants including rs11136000 that are linked to Alzheimer disease susceptibility. Clusterin influences amyloid-beta clearance and aggregation.

title: CR1 complement receptor variants
text: Variants in the complement receptor 1 gene CR1, particularly rs6656401, contribute to AD risk through altered complement cascade regulation and amyloid clearance mechanisms.

title: PICALM endocytosis and AD
text: The PICALM gene variant rs3851179 affects clathrin-mediated endocytosis and is associated with reduced Alzheimer disease risk. PICALM influences APP processing and amyloid-beta production.

title: MS4A gene cluster associations
text: Multiple variants in the MS4A gene cluster including rs983392 are implicated in Alzheimer disease pathogenesis through immune cell function modulation.

title: CD33 myeloid cell receptor
text: The rs3865444 polymorphism in CD33 affects microglial clearance of amyloid-beta plaques and modulates Alzheimer disease risk in multiple populations.

title: ABCA7 lipid transport
text: Loss-of-function variants in ABCA7, including rs3764650, increase AD susceptibility. ABCA7 regulates lipid homeostasis and affects amyloid processing in the brain.

title: SORL1 and APP trafficking
text: Variants in SORL1 such as rs11218343 influence APP trafficking and processing. SORL1 dysfunction leads to increased amyloid-beta production and Alzheimer disease risk.

title: GWAS meta-analysis identifies novel loci
text: Large-scale genome-wide association study meta-analysis identified 29 risk loci for Alzheimer disease including ZCWPW1, ADAMTS1, and HESX1 variants at genome-wide significance.

title: PTK2B signaling in AD
text: The protein tyrosine kinase PTK2B contains variant rs28834970 linked to cognitive decline and Alzheimer disease. PTK2B regulates calcium signaling in neurons.

title: SPI1 transcription factor variants
text: Variants near SPI1 at rs1057233 affect myeloid cell gene expression and are associated with Alzheimer disease risk through altered microglial function.

title: INPP5D phosphatase and immunity
text: The immune-related phosphatase gene INPP5D harbors rs35349669 which modulates microglial responses and contributes to AD pathogenesis.

title: MEF2C neuronal transcription
text: MEF2C transcription factor variants including rs190982 are linked to Alzheimer disease and regulate neuronal survival and synaptic function genes.

title: NME8 ciliary function
text: Rare variants in NME8 affect ciliary function and are associated with increased risk of cognitive impairment and Alzheimer disease in specific populations.

title: ZCWPW1 histone binding
text: The histone-binding protein ZCWPW1 contains variant rs1476679 associated with Alzheimer disease risk. ZCWPW1 may influence chromatin remodeling in neurons.

title: CASS4 cytoskeletal regulation
text: Variants in CASS4 at rs7274581 affect cytoskeletal dynamics and are linked to Alzheimer disease through altered neuronal morphology and connectivity.

title: FERMT2 integrin signaling
text: The FERMT2 gene variant rs17125944 modulates integrin signaling pathways and contributes to Alzheimer disease susceptibility through blood-brain barrier dysfunction.

title: HLA-DRB1 immune associations
text: Major histocompatibility complex variants in HLA-DRB1 including rs9271192 are associated with AD risk and influence immune responses to amyloid pathology.

title: EPHA1 receptor tyrosine kinase
text: The ephrin receptor EPHA1 contains variants such as rs11767557 that affect synaptic plasticity and are linked to Alzheimer disease cognitive decline.

title: CD2AP adaptor protein
text: CD2AP variants at rs9349407 influence cytoskeletal organization and blood-brain barrier integrity, contributing to Alzheimer disease pathogenesis.

title: CELF1 RNA binding protein
text: The RNA-binding protein CELF1 harbors variant rs10838725 associated with cognitive impairment. CELF1 regulates alternative splicing in neurons affected by AD.

title: TRIP4 transcriptional coactivator
text: Variants in TRIP4 including rs74615166 are linked to Alzheimer disease and may affect transcriptional regulation of genes involved in neuronal function.

title: ACE angiotensin converting enzyme
text: The ACE gene contains polymorphisms such as rs1800764 that influence blood pressure regulation and are associated with increased dementia risk.

title: MAPT tau protein variants
text: Although primarily linked to frontotemporal dementia, MAPT variants including rs242557 influence tau protein structure and contribute to Alzheimer disease neuropathology.

title: GRN progranulin deficiency
text: Loss-of-function mutations in progranulin gene GRN cause frontotemporal dementia and certain variants like rs5848 modify Alzheimer disease risk through inflammatory pathways.

title: TMEM106B lysosomal function
text: The TMEM106B variant rs1990622 affects lysosomal function and modulates risk for multiple neurodegenerative diseases including Alzheimer disease.

title: ADAM10 alpha-secretase activity
text: ADAM10 is the major alpha-secretase for APP. Variants such as rs593742 that enhance ADAM10 activity reduce amyloid-beta production and AD risk.

title: APOC1 apolipoprotein cluster
text: The APOC1 gene in the APOE cluster contains variant rs4420638 independently associated with Alzheimer disease risk through lipid metabolism effects.

title: Population-specific variants in African Americans
text: African American populations show unique AD risk loci including variants in ABCA7 at rs115550680 and novel associations not observed in European populations.

title: Asian population AD genetics
text: Asian populations demonstrate distinct genetic architecture for AD with population-specific associations at loci including SHARPIN rs34173062 and different APOE effect sizes.

title: Hispanic cohort genetic findings
text: Caribbean Hispanic populations reveal unique AD susceptibility variants and show stronger associations with certain loci compared to non-Hispanic white populations.

title: Gene-gene interactions in AD
text: Epistatic interactions between APOE and TOMM40 variants modify Alzheimer disease risk beyond their individual effects, suggesting complex genetic architecture.

title: Polygenic risk scores for AD
text: Polygenic risk scores combining hundreds of variants including rs429358, rs75932628, and rs744373 predict Alzheimer disease risk with improved accuracy over single variants.

title: CSF biomarker genetic associations
text: Variants in APP, PSEN1, and PSEN2 are strongly associated with cerebrospinal fluid levels of amyloid-beta and tau proteins, key AD biomarkers.

title: Brain imaging endophenotypes
text: Genetic variants in CLU and PICALM are associated with hippocampal atrophy and white matter hyperintensities on MRI in Alzheimer disease patients.

title: Age of onset genetic modifiers
text: APOE ε4 dosage and TREM2 R47H variant significantly influence age of Alzheimer disease onset, with homozygous APOE ε4 carriers showing earliest symptom onset.

title: Cognitive decline trajectory variants
text: Variants in BDNF at rs6265 and COMT at rs4680 modify the rate of cognitive decline in Alzheimer disease patients independent of primary disease risk.

title: Neuropathology genetic correlations
text: Genetic variants show distinct associations with amyloid plaque burden versus neurofibrillary tangle pathology, suggesting partially independent genetic control of AD pathologies.

title: Inflammatory pathway variants
text: Multiple immune-related genes including IL1A, IL1B, and TNF contain variants that modulate neuroinflammation and contribute to Alzheimer disease progression.

title: Lipid metabolism in AD genetics
text: Beyond APOE, variants in lipid metabolism genes ABCA1, ABCA7, and APOC1 influence cholesterol homeostasis and amyloid processing in the brain.

title: Endocytic pathway dysfunction
text: Convergent genetic evidence implicates endocytic pathway genes PICALM, BIN1, CD2AP, and RIN3 in Alzheimer disease through effects on APP trafficking.

title: Microglial gene expression
text: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals that AD risk variants in TREM2, CD33, and MS4A are expressed in microglia and affect disease-associated microglial states.

title: Synaptic function genetic variants
text: Variants in synaptic genes including PTK2B, MEF2C, and EPHA1 converge on pathways regulating synaptic plasticity and neurotransmission in AD.

title: Tau propagation mechanisms
text: Genetic studies suggest variants in BIN1 and PICALM may influence trans-synaptic spreading of pathological tau in Alzheimer disease brain networks.

title: Blood-brain barrier genetics
text: Variants in FERMT2 and CD2AP affect blood-brain barrier integrity and may contribute to AD pathogenesis through vascular dysfunction mechanisms.

title: Autophagy pathway in neurodegeneration
text: Genetic variants in autophagy-related genes SORL1 and TMEM106B influence protein degradation pathways critical for preventing neurodegeneration in AD.

title: Calcium signaling dysregulation
text: Variants in genes regulating calcium homeostasis including CALHM1 and RYR3 are associated with altered calcium signaling and AD susceptibility.

title: Mitochondrial dysfunction variants
text: Nuclear-encoded mitochondrial genes harbor variants that affect oxidative phosphorylation and contribute to bioenergetic failure in Alzheimer disease neurons.

title: Rare variant burden analysis
text: Exome sequencing identifies rare damaging variants in TREM2, SORL1, and ABCA7 that collectively contribute substantial population-attributable risk for AD.

title: Structural variant associations
text: Copy number variations and structural variants near complement genes C4A and C4B influence neuroinflammation and Alzheimer disease risk.

title: Expression QTL studies
text: Brain expression quantitative trait loci reveal that many AD GWAS variants act by regulating gene expression in neurons and glial cells.

title: Splicing QTL in brain tissue
text: Alternative splicing QTLs demonstrate that AD risk variants in genes like BIN1 alter RNA splicing patterns in brain tissue.

title: DNA methylation and AD
text: Genetic variants influence DNA methylation patterns at AD-associated loci, suggesting epigenetic mechanisms contribute to disease susceptibility.

title: Sex-specific genetic effects
text: APOE ε4 shows stronger association with AD risk in females compared to males, indicating sex-specific genetic architecture of disease susceptibility.

title: Gene-environment interactions
text: Interactions between APOE genotype and environmental factors including education and physical activity modify Alzheimer disease risk.

title: Drug target genetic validation
text: Genetic evidence supports drug targets including BACE1 and gamma-secretase components for therapeutic intervention in Alzheimer disease.

title: Resilience to AD pathology
text: Genetic studies of cognitively normal individuals with significant AD pathology identify protective variants that may inform therapeutic strategies.

title: Familial AD mutations
text: Rare mutations in APP, PSEN1, and PSEN2 cause early-onset familial Alzheimer disease through increased amyloid-beta production or altered Aβ42/40 ratio.
